title: How to say, I was a little upset or I was little upset, which one is correct - Quora

response.answer_text: Both the sentences are grammatically correct but carry different meaning. A little carries positive overtones meaning some. So the first sentence means that I was upset to some extent or quite a bit. Little carries negative overtones meaning nearly not. So the second sentence means that I was not upset. We can explain few, a few also in the same manner. ( Ref. Secrets of Grammar, Amazon)
